title: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park: Park Statistics
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Park Statistics              Park Statistics        Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park, as an integral part of Skagway, participates in the yearly Fourth of July parade.  Ranger Susannah and a volunteer lead the way for the 2015 park float. NPS photo/S. Millard       Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park is the most visited National Park site in Alaska.  The latest information on visitation statistics, annual reports, and budget information for Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park can be found on the National Park Statistics page.
